item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 3:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Apple Mobile Processors Are Now Made in America. By TSMC (191 points | 73 comments)
2. macOS Sequoia 15 may bypass DNS encryption (348 points | 114 comments)
3. Entire Independent Board of Directors of 23andMe Resigns (201 points | 94 comments)
4. Atkinson Hyperlegible Font (293 points | 84 comments)
5. GraalPy – A high-performance embeddable Python 3 runtime for Java (200 points | 90 comments)
6. The Lego Great Ball Contraption (157 points | 23 comments)
7. Rga: Ripgrep, but also search in PDFs, E-Books, Office documents, zip, etc. (321 points | 29 comments)
8. Show HN: Open Scanner, an open-source document scanning app for iPhone (166 points | 52 comments)
9. Exploring pre-1990 versions of wc(1) (2023) (10 points | 1 comment)
10. Emerge Tools (YC W21) is hiring a senior front end engineer ( | hide)
11. TexTube: Chat with any YouTube video transcript in ChatGPT fast (95 points | 56 comments)
12. The Double Irish Dutch Sandwich: End of a Tax Evasion Strategy (141 points | 131 comments)
13. Reports of the Death of Dental Cavities Are Greatly Exaggerated (38 points | 14 comments)
14. A Friendly Introduction to Assembly for High-Level Programmers (51 points | 2 comments)
15. OpenTelemetry Tracing in < 200 lines of code (123 points | 15 comments)
16. Hezbollah pager explosions kill several people in Lebanon (651 points | 1536 comments)
17. Why Gauss wanted a heptadecagon on his tombstone (214 points | 48 comments)
18. STORM: Get a Wikipedia-like report on your topic (68 points | 37 comments)
19. Launch HN: Marblism (YC W24) – Generate full-stack web apps from a prompt (95 points | 65 comments)
20. WonderWorld: Interactive 3D Scene Generation from a Single Image (115 points | 12 comments)
21. John Peralta Explodes Historic Technology into Three-Dimensional Diagrams (5 points | discuss)
22. Show HN: Will I run Boston 2025? (39 points | 37 comments)
23. The centrality of stupidity in mathematics (216 points | 130 comments)
24. Scrolling Text Display (10 points | discuss)
25. In 1926, TV Was Mechanical (98 points | 30 comments)
26. Signatures of gravitational atoms from black hole mergers (104 points | 53 comments)
27. Show HN: Finic – Open source platform for building browser automations (103 points | 62 comments)
28. Race conditions in Linux Kernel perf events (71 points | 12 comments)
29. Krazam: High Agency Individual Contributor [video] (186 points | 42 comments)
30. Swift 6 (328 points | 220 comments)
